verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: This verse introduces the command, as in the Hebrew.

verses.text: This shall be the law for the leprous person on the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest,
verses.comment: The term 'leprous person' translates the Hebrew 'metzora', covering various skin diseases.

verses.text: and the priest shall go out of the camp, and the priest shall examine him. And if the disease is healed in the leprous person,
verses.comment: Priest's examination outside the camp as required.

verses.text: then the priest shall command them to take for him who is to be cleansed two live clean birds, and cedarwood, and scarlet yarn, and hyssop.
verses.comment: Sacrificial items listed; 'scarlet' here is 'scarlet yarn' per Hebrew.

verses.text: And the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel over running water.
verses.comment: “Running water” is from the Hebrew “living water.”

verses.text: As for the living bird, he shall take it and the cedarwood and the scarlet yarn and the hyssop, and dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
verses.comment: Cleansing ritual, all items dipped.

verses.text: And he shall sprinkle it seven times on him who is to be cleansed of the leprous disease, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird go into the open field.
verses.comment: Sevenfold sprinkling symbolizing completeness.

verses.text: And he who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes and shave off all his hair and bathe himself in water, and he shall be clean. After that, he may come into the camp, but shall stay outside his tent for seven days.
verses.comment: “Shave off all his hair” is literal Hebrew. Seven days' isolation added.

verses.text: On the seventh day he shall shave off all his hair: his head, his beard, his eyebrows. He shall shave off all his hair, then he shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and he shall be clean.
verses.comment: Details of shaving and washing highlight completeness of cleansing.

verses.text: On the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without blemish, and one ewe lamb without blemish, and three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, and one log of oil.
verses.comment: Offerings listed as per law.

verses.text: And the priest who cleanses him shall set the man who is to be cleansed and these things before the LORD at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: “Tent of meeting” reflects Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering, along with the log of oil, and wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
verses.comment: Wave offering denotes ritual dedication.

verses.text: He shall slaughter the lamb in the place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered, in the holy place. For the guilt offering, like the sin offering, belongs to the priest; it is most holy.
verses.comment: “Most holy” matches original sanctity concept.

verses.text: The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
verses.comment: Symbolic anointing of the cleansed person’s extremities.

verses.text: Then the priest shall take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
verses.comment: “Log” is an ancient measure of liquid, about 0.3 liters.

verses.text: And the priest shall dip his right finger into the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
verses.comment: Sevenfold sprinkling for ritual completeness.

verses.text: And the priest shall put some of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, on top of the blood of the guilt offering.
verses.comment: Oil symbolically seals the cleansing over the blood.

verses.text: And the rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall pour on the head of the one being cleansed. So the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD.
verses.comment: Pouring oil on the head as mark of consecration.

verses.text: Then the priest shall offer the sin offering and make atonement for the one being cleansed from his uncleanness. After that, he shall slaughter the burnt offering.
verses.comment: Order of offerings; sin offering first, then burnt offering.

verses.text: And the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar. So the priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
verses.comment: “Atonement… he shall be clean”—restored to ritual purity.

verses.text: But if he is poor and cannot afford these, then he shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering to be waved, to make atonement for him, and one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and a log of oil;
verses.comment: Provision for poverty—less costly offerings allowed.

verses.text: also two turtledoves or two young pigeons, whichever he can afford. One shall be a sin offering and the other a burnt offering.
verses.comment: Alternative birds if unable to afford lambs.

verses.text: And on the eighth day he shall bring them for his cleansing to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the LORD.
And the priest shall take the lamb of the guilt offering and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.

And he shall slaughter the lamb of the guilt offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
And the priest shall pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.
And he shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD.

And the priest shall put some of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, in the place of the blood of the guilt offering.
And the rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put on the head of the one being cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.

And he shall offer, of the turtledoves or pigeons, whichever he can afford, one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering along with the grain offering. And the priest shall make atonement for the one being cleansed before the LORD.
This is the law for him in whom is the disease of leprosy who cannot afford the offerings for his cleansing.
The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.comment: Shifts focus to laws about houses.

verses.text: When you come into the land of Canaan, which I give you for a possession, and I put a case of leprous disease in a house in the land of your possession,
verses.comment: Now discussing uncleanness in houses.

verses.text: then he who owns the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, 'There seems to me to be some sort of disease in my house.'

Then the priest shall command that they empty the house before the priest goes in to examine the disease, so that nothing in the house may become unclean. Afterward the priest shall go in to inspect the house.
And he shall examine the disease. If the disease is in the walls of the house with greenish or reddish spots, and they appear deeper than the surface of the wall,
then the priest shall go out of the house to the door, and shut up the house for seven days.
verses.comment: Parallel to procedure for a person.

verses.text: And the priest shall come again on the seventh day, and look. If the disease has spread in the walls of the house,
then the priest shall command that they take out the stones in which is the disease, and throw them into an unclean place outside the city.
And he shall have the inside of the house scraped all around, and the plaster that they scrape off they shall pour out into an unclean place outside the city.
Then they shall take other stones and put them in the place of those stones, and he shall take other plaster and plaster the house.
If the disease returns and breaks out in the house after he has taken out the stones and scraped the house and plastered it,
then the priest shall go in and look. If the disease has spread in the house, it is a persistent leprous disease in the house; it is unclean.
And he shall break down the house, its stones and timber and all the plaster of the house, and take them outside the city to an unclean place.
Moreover, whoever goes into the house while it is shut up shall be unclean until the evening.
And whoever sleeps in the house shall wash his clothes, and whoever eats in the house shall wash his clothes.
But if the priest comes and looks, and the disease has not spread in the house after the house was plastered, then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, for the disease is healed.
And he shall take, to cleanse the house, two birds, and cedarwood, and scarlet yarn, and hyssop.
verses.comment: Same items used for cleansing a person.

verses.text: And he shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.

And he shall take the cedarwood and the hyssop and the scarlet yarn, together with the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the bird that was killed and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
He shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and the running water, and the living bird, and the cedarwood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn.
He shall let the living bird go out of the city into the open field. So he shall make atonement for the house, and it shall be clean.
verses.comment: Ritual similar to that for the person.

verses.text: This is the law for any case of leprous disease: for an eruption, for leprosy in a garment or in a house,
verses.comment: Summation, covering all cases.

verses.text: and for a swelling or an eruption or a spot,
to show when it is unclean and when it is clean. This is the law for leprous disease.
verses.comment: Final legal declaration.

verses.text: to show when it is unclean and when it is clean. This is the law for leprous disease.
verses.comment: Note: verse 56 is sometimes merged with verse 55. Retained as per major English witnesses.

verses.text: This is the law for leprous disease: regarding infection in a garment or a house, and regarding swelling, eruption, or a bright spot, to indicate when it is unclean and when it is clean.
verses.comment: Closing summary. No inclusivity changes. Word for word maintained.
